title: Can Prince William Help the Royal Family?
summary: This article talks about the British Royal Family and how people feel about them. David Dimbleby, who has worked on TV for a long time, made a documentary to learn more. He found that fewer people think the monarchy is important now compared to the past, especially young people. The article says this is a problem because the Royal Family needs public support to survive. It mentions scandals with Prince Andrew and Harry and Meghan, but says the bigger issue is what the monarchy means today. Prince William is trying to act like a normal person to win back support. The article asks if this will work and what King Charles and William should do to make people like the monarchy more.

background_read: The British Royal Family includes the king or queen and their family. They have special roles in the UK, but some people think they are not needed anymore. This article looks at why fewer people support them and what they can do to change that.
Article_Structure: WHO: David Dimbleby and experts like Anna Whitelock and Ian Hislop
WHAT: Discusses declining public support for the British monarchy and Prince William's efforts to win it back
WHY: To explore if the monarchy can adapt to modern times and regain popularity

perspectives.description: Some people believe the monarchy is important for tradition and unity.
Others think the monarchy is outdated and costs too much money.
